Class.name: Object
Class.Description: Root of the class hierarchy. Every class in OpenDMA extends this class. All objects in OpenDMA have the properties defined for this class.

Property.name: Class
Property.Abstract: Reference to a valid class object describing this object
Property.Description: The opendma:Class describes the layout and features of this object. Here you can find a set of odma:PropertyInfo objects that describe all the properties with their qualified name, data type and cardinality. It also provides the text to be displayed to users to refer to these objects as well as flags indicating if these objects are system owner or should be hidden from end users.

Property.name: Id
Property.Abstract: the unique object identifier
Property.Description: This identifier is unique within it's Repository and must be immutable during the lifetime of this object. You can use it to refer to this object and retrieve it again at a later time.

Property.name: Guid
Property.Abstract: the global unique object identifier
Property.Description: A combination of the unique object identifier and the unique repository identifier. Use it to refer to this object across multiple repositories.

Property.name: Repository
Property.Abstract: the Repository this object belongs to

Class.name: Class
Class.Description: Describes Classes and Aspects in OpenDMA. Every object in OpenDMA has a reference to an instance of this class describing it.

Property.name: Name
Property.Abstract: the name part of the qualified name of the class described by this object
Property.Description: The qualified name is a technical identifier that typically has some restrictions, e.g. for database table names. The DisplayName in contrast is tailored for end users.

Property.name: Namespace
Property.Abstract: the namespace part of the qualified name of the class described by this object
Property.Description: The qualified name is a technical identifier that typically has some restrictions, e.g. for database table names. The DisplayName in contrast is tailored for end users.

Property.name: DisplayName
Property.Abstract: Text shown to end users to refer to this class
Property.Description: The qualified name is a technical identifier that typically has some restrictions, e.g. for database table names. The DisplayName in contrast is tailored for end users.

Property.name: SuperClass
Property.Abstract: Super class of this class or aspect.
Property.Description: OpenDMA guarantees this relationship to be loop-free. You can use it to explore the class hierarchy starting from the class described by this object. All opendma:PropertyInfo objects contained in the opendma:Properties set of the super class are also part of the opendma:Properties set of this class.

Property.name: Aspects
Property.Abstract: List of aspects that are implemented by this class
Property.Description: If this object describes an Aspect, i.e. the opendma:Aspect property is true, it cannot have any Aspects itself. For classes, this set contains all elements of the opendma:Aspects set of the super class. All opendma:PropertyInfo objects contained in the opendma:Properties set of any of the opendma:Class objects in this set are also part of the opendma:Properties set of this class.

Property.name: DeclaredProperties
Property.Abstract: List of properties declared by this class
Property.Description: Set of opendma:PropertyInfo objects describing properties newly introduced by this level in the class hierarchy. All elements of this set are also contained in the opendma:Properties set. Properties cannot be overwritten, i.e. the qualified nyme of any property described by an opendma:PropertyInfo object in this set cannot be used in the opendma:Properties sets of the super class or any Aspect.

Property.name: Properties
Property.Abstract: List of effective properties
Property.Description: Set of opendma:PropertyInfo objects describing all properties of an object of this class. This set combines the opendma:DeclaredProperties set with the opendma:Properties of the super class as well as the opendma:Properties sets of all aspect objects listed in opendma:Aspects. Properties cannot be overwritten, i.e. the qualified nyme of any property described by an opendma:PropertyInfo object in the opendma:DeclaredProperties set cannot be used in the opendma:Properties sets of the super class or any Aspect.

Property.name: Aspect
Property.Abstract: Indicates if this object represents an Aspect (true) or a Class (false)

Property.name: Instantiable
Property.Abstract: Indicates if there can ob objects of this class (true) or if this class is abstract (false)

Property.name: Hidden
Property.Abstract: Indicates if this class should be hidden from end users and probably administrators

Property.name: System
Property.Abstract: Indicates if instances of this class are owned and managed by the system

Property.name: Retrievable
Property.Abstract: Indicates if instances of this class can by retrieved by their Id

Property.name: Searchable
Property.Abstract: Indicates if instances of this class can be retrieved in a search

Property.name: SubClasses
Property.Abstract: List of classes or aspects that extend this class
Property.Description: The value of the `opendma:SubClasses` property is exactly the set of valid class objects whose `opendma:SuperClass` property contains a reference to this class info object

ApiHelper.Abstract: the qualified name of this class
ApiHelper.Description: A convenience shortcut to getting the name and namespace separately

Class.name: PropertyInfo
Class.Description: Describes a property in OpenmDMA. Every object in OpenDMA has a reference to an opendma:Class which has the opendma:Properties set of PropertyInfo objects. Each describes one of the properties on the object.

Property.name: Name
Property.Abstract: The name part of the qualified name of this property
Property.Description: The qualified name is a technical identifier that typically has some restrictions, e.g. for database table names. The DisplayName in contrast is tailored for end users.

Property.name: Namespace
Property.Abstract: The namespace part of the qualified name of this property
Property.Description: The qualified name is a technical identifier that typically has some restrictions, e.g. for database table names. The DisplayName in contrast is tailored for end users.

Property.name: DisplayName
Property.Abstract: Text shown to end users to refer to this property
Property.Description: The qualified name is a technical identifier that typically has some restrictions, e.g. for database table names. The DisplayName in contrast is tailored for end users.

Property.name: DataType
Property.Abstract: Numeric data type ID
Property.Description: The data type of the property described by this object. See also the OdmaType enumeration for a mapping between the numeric type id and the type.

Property.name: ReferenceClass
Property.Abstract: The opendma:Class values of the property described by this object must be an instance of if and only if the data type is "Reference" (8), null otherwise

Property.name: MultiValue
Property.Abstract: Indicates if this property has single or multi cardinality

Property.name: Required
Property.Abstract: Indicates if at least one value is required

Property.name: ReadOnly
Property.Abstract: Indicates if this property can be updated

Property.name: Hidden
Property.Abstract: Indicates if this class should be hidden from end users and probably administrators

Property.name: System
Property.Abstract: Indicates if instances of this property are owned and managed by the system

Property.name: Choices
Property.Abstract: List of opendma:ChoiceValue instances each describing one valid value for this property
Property.Description: OpenDMA can restrict values of a property to a predefined set of valid values. In this case, this set is not empty and each opendma:ChoiceValue describes one valid option. If this set is empty, any value is allowed.

ApiHelper.Abstract: the qualified name of this class
ApiHelper.Description: A convenience shortcut to getting the name and namespace separately

Class.name: ChoiceValue
Class.Description: Describes a possible value of a property

Property.name: DisplayName
Property.Abstract: Text shown to end users to refer to this possible value option
Property.Description: This DisplayName indirections allows Administrators to define friendly descriptions for end users while storing internal numbers or abbreviation in the system

Property.name: StringValue
Property.Abstract: the String value of this choice or null, if the property info this choice is assigned to is not of data type String
Property.Description: Full description follows.

Property.name: IntegerValue
Property.Abstract: the Integer value of this choice or null, if the property info this choice is assigned to is not of data type Integer
Property.Description: Full description follows.

Property.name: ShortValue
Property.Abstract: the Short value of this choice or null, if the property info this choice is assigned to is not of data type Short
Property.Description: Full description follows.

Property.name: LongValue
Property.Abstract: the Long value of this choice or null, if the property info this choice is assigned to is not of data type Long
Property.Description: Full description follows.

Property.name: FloatValue
Property.Abstract: the Float value of this choice or null, if the property info this choice is assigned to is not of data type Float
Property.Description: Full description follows.

Property.name: DoubleValue
Property.Abstract: the Double value of this choice or null, if the property info this choice is assigned to is not of data type Double
Property.Description: Full description follows.

Property.name: BooleanValue
Property.Abstract: the Boolean value of this choice or null, if the property info this choice is assigned to is not of data type Boolean
Property.Description: Full description follows.

Property.name: DateTimeValue
Property.Abstract: the DateTime value of this choice or null, if the property info this choice is assigned to is not of data type DateTime
Property.Description: Full description follows.

Property.name: BlobValue
Property.Abstract: the BLOB value of this choice or null, if the property info this choice is assigned to is not of data type BLOB
Property.Description: Full description follows.

Property.name: ReferenceValue
Property.Abstract: the Reference value of this choice or null, if the property info this choice is assigned to is not of data type Reference
Property.Description: Full description follows.

Class.name: Repository
Class.Description: A Repository represents a place where all Objects are stored. It often constitues a data isolation boundary where objects with different management requirements or access restrictions are separated into different repositories. Qualified names of classes and properties as well as unique object identifiers are only unique within a repository. They can be reused across different repositories. Object references are limited in scope within a single repository.

Property.name: Name
Property.Abstract: the internal technical name of this repository
Property.Description: The name is a technical identifier that typically has some restrictions, e.g. for database table names. The DisplayName in contrast is tailored for end users.

Property.name: DisplayName
Property.Abstract: the text shown to end users to refer to this repository
Property.Description: The name is a technical identifier that typically has some restrictions, e.g. for database table names. The DisplayName in contrast is tailored for end users.

Property.name: RootClass
Property.Abstract: Valid class object describing the class hierarchy root

Property.name: RootAspects
Property.Abstract: set of valid aspect objects without a super class

Property.name: RootFolder
Property.Abstract: Object that has the opendma:Folder aspect representing the single root if this repository has a dedicated folder tree, null otherwise
Property.Description: Full description follows.

Class.name: Document
Class.Description: A Document is the atomic element users work on in a content based environment. It can be compared to a file in a file system. Unlike files, it may consist of multiple octet streams. These content streams can for example contain images of the individual pages that make up the document. A Document is able to keep track of its changes (versioning) and manage the access to it (checkin and checkout).

Property.name: Title
Property.Abstract: the title of this document
Property.Description: Typically a human friendly readable description of this document. Does not need to be a file name, but can be the file name.

Property.name: Version
Property.Abstract: Identifier of this version consisting of a set of numbers separated by a point (e.g. 1.2.3)
Property.Description: This value is heavily vendor specific. You should not have any expectations of the format.

Property.name: VersionCollection
Property.Abstract: reference to a opendma:VersionCollection object representing all versions of this document or null if versioning is not supported

Property.name: VersionIndependentId
Property.Abstract: the unique object identifier identifying this logical document independent from the specific version inside its opendma:Repository
Property.Description: Retrieving this Id from the Repository will result in the latest version

Property.name: VersionIndependentGuid
Property.Abstract: the global unique object identifier globally identifying this logical document independent from the specific version

Property.name: ContentElements
Property.Abstract: set of opendma:ContentElement objects representing the individual binary elements this document is made up of
Property.Description: Typically has only one element. Can contain more then one element in rare cases, e.g. if individual pages of a document are scanned as separate images

Property.name: CombinedContentType
Property.Abstract: the combined conent type of the whole Document, calculated from the content types of each ContentElement

Property.name: PrimaryContentElement
Property.Abstract: the dedicated primary ContentElement. May only be null if ContentElements is empty.

Property.name: CreatedAt
Property.Abstract: the timestamp when this version of this document has been created

Property.name: CreatedBy
Property.Abstract: the User who created this version of this document

Property.name: LastModifiedAt
Property.Abstract: the timestamp when this version of this document has been modified the last time

Property.name: LastModifiedBy
Property.Abstract: the user who modified this version of this document the last time

Property.name: CheckedOut
Property.Abstract: indicates if this document is checked out

Property.name: CheckedOutAt
Property.Abstract: the timestamp when this version of the document has been checked out, null if this document is not checked out

Property.name: CheckedOutBy
Property.Abstract: the user who checked out this version of this document, null if this document is not checked out
Property.Description: Full description follows.

Class.name: ContentElement
Class.Description: A ContentElement represents one atomic content element the Documents are made of. This abstract (non instantiable) base class defines the type of content and the position of this element in the sequence of all content elements.

Property.name: ContentType
Property.Abstract: the content type (aka MIME type) of the content represented by this element

Property.name: Position
Property.Abstract: the position of this element in the list of all content elements of the containing document

Class.name: DataContentElement
Class.Description: A DataContentElement represents one atomic octet stream. The binary data is stored together with meta data like size and filename

Property.name: Content
Property.Abstract: the binary data of this content element

Property.name: Size
Property.Abstract: the size of the data in number of octets

Property.name: FileName
Property.Abstract: the optional file name of the data

Class.name: ReferenceContentElement
Class.Description: A ReferenceContentElement represents a reference to external data. The reference is stored as URI to the content location.

Property.name: Location
Property.Abstract: the URI where the content is stored

Class.name: VersionCollection
Class.Description: A VersionCollection represents the set of all versions of a Document. Based on the actual document management system, it can represent a single series of versions, a tree of version, or any other versioning concept.

Property.name: Versions
Property.Abstract: Set of all versions of a document

Property.name: Latest
Property.Abstract: Latest version of a document

Property.name: Released
Property.Abstract: Latest released version of a document if a version has been released

Property.name: InProgress
Property.Abstract: Latest checked out working copy of a document

Class.name: Container
Class.Description: A Container holds a set of containable objects that are said to be contained in this Container. This list of containees is build up with Association objects based on references to the containmer and the containee. This allows an object to be contained in multiple Containers or in no Container at all. A Container does not enforce a loop-free single rooted tree. Use a folder instead for this requirement.

Property.name: Title
Property.Abstract: the title of this container

Property.name: Containees
Property.Abstract: the set of containable objects contained in this container

Property.name: Associations
Property.Abstract: the set of associations between this container and the contained objects

Property.name: CreatedAt
Property.Abstract: the timestamp when this container has been created

Property.name: CreatedBy
Property.Abstract: the user who created this container

Property.name: LastModifiedAt
Property.Abstract: the timestamp when this container has been modified the last time
Property.Description: There is no definition what counts as a modification. Some systems update this timestamp when objects are added or removed, other systems only update this timestamp when properties of this object get changed.

Property.name: LastModifiedBy
Property.Abstract: the user who modified this container the last time
Property.Description: There is no definition what counts as a modification. Some systems update this timestamp when objects are added or removed, other systems only update this timestamp when properties of this object get changed.

Class.name: Folder
Class.Description: A Folder is an extension of the Container forming one single rooted loop-free tree.

Property.name: Parent
Property.Abstract: the parent folder this folder is contained in
Property.Description: Following this property from folder object to folder object will ultimately lead to the single root folder of the Repository. This is the only folder having a null value for this property

Property.name: SubFolders
Property.Abstract: the set of Folder objects that contain this folder in their opendma:Parent property
Property.Description: Using this property for a tree walk is safe. A folder is guaranteed to be loop free. It is neither defined if this set of objects is also part of the opendma:Containees property nor if there are corresponding association objects in opendma:Associations for each folder in this set.

Class.name: Containable
Class.Description: The Containable aspect is used by all classes and aspects that can be contained in a Container.

Property.name: ContainedIn
Property.Abstract: the set of container objects this Containable is contained in

Property.name: ContainedInAssociations
Property.Abstract: the set of associations that bind this Containable in the opendma:Conatiner objects

Class.name: Association
Class.Description: An Association represents the directed link between an opendma:Container and an opendma:Containable object.

Property.name: Name
Property.Abstract: the name of this association
Property.Description: This name is used to refer to this specific association in the context of it's container and tell tem apart. Many systems pose additional constraints on this name.

Property.name: Container
Property.Abstract: the source of this directed link

Property.name: Containable
Property.Abstract: the destination of this directed link

Property.name: CreatedAt
Property.Abstract: the timestamp when this association has been created

Property.name: CreatedBy
Property.Abstract: the user who created this association

Property.name: LastModifiedAt
Property.Abstract: the timestamp when this association has been modified the last time

Property.name: LastModifiedBy
Property.Abstract: the user who modified this association the last time
